p: Based on the estimation that 45% of samples would be positive to influenza A or B, a sample size of 173 patients was required.[ 25] In this case, a specificity and sensitivity of 99% could be estimated with an accuracy of 2%.[ 23] We included at least 185 patients in order to account for possible assay failures. The performance parameter results are expressed as 95% confidence intervals (CI) and the alpha risk was set at 5%. 95% CI for sensitivity and specificity were calculated according to the score method corrected for continuity.[ 24, 25] Categorical data are expressed as numbers and percentages and quantitative data are expressed as medians and interquartile ranges (IQR). Missing data were not replaced. Statistical analyses were performed with SPSS (v20, SPSS Inc., Chicago, IL, USA).
